str2: If indeed, if so. From ei and per; if perhaps.
From dike; equitable; by implication, innocent, holy.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
To give in return, recompense. From anti and apodidomi; to requite.
Persecution, affliction, distress, tribulation. From thlibo; pressure.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I make narrow (strictly: by pressure); I press upon, (b) I persecute, press hard. Akin to the base of tribos; to crowd.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
